item.title: Elden Ring Player Discovers Trick With Spinning Strikes Ash of War
item.description:
Summary

  • Elden Ring's Spinning Strikes Ash of War can deflect projectiles.
  • While the game doesn't keep this feature a secret, some players have been unaware of it up until recently.

One Elden Ring player has recently discovered a new use for the Spinning Strikes Ash of War after accidentally deflecting Margit's daggers with it. While the game makes no attempt to keep this feature a secret, a decent chunk of the Elden Ring community was seemingly unaware of it up until recently.

Ash of War: Spinning Strikes is a self-explanatory Ash of War that can be obtained early on in the game, shortly after reaching Castle Morne in the south of the Weeping Peninsula. However, players who don't have a habit of killing non-hostile NPCs won't obtain it before reaching Elden Ring 's Liurnia of the Lakes region. The Ash of War itself allows Tarnished to spin in place with a compatible weapon (polearm) for a relatively low FP cost, making for a resource-efficient source of melee AoE damage.

As it turns out, hitting multiple enemies at once isn't the only thing that Spinning Strikes are good for. Reddit user Fail1ure recently discovered that this Ash of War can also counter Margit's dagger throws. The moment unfolded completely by accident, as the player was already mid-animation when Margit began his attack. Much to their surprise, Spinning Strikes nullified every single dagger. The player then successfully replicated this hidden Elden Ring interaction on video, sharing the resulting demonstration on the game's largest subreddit.

Spinning Strikes Can Nullify More Than Just Margit's Daggers

Fail1ure's video amassed over 7,000 upvotes within 24 hours of going live in late April 2025, suggesting a decent chunk of the Elden Ring player base was unaware of this trick up until now. Granted, Margit's dagger throws hardly needed any more counters, as they are already one of his least threatening attacks, dealing modest damage while being super easy to avoid by just strafing in any direction. Be that as it may, this demonstration serves as a reminder that Spinning Strikes are worth trying against other thrown attacks from more difficult bosses. They are also confirmed to work for deflecting thrown items in PvP.

While some Elden Ring players have clearly been unaware of Spinning Strikes' ability to deflect flying objects up until recently, the game doesn't keep this feature a secret. The Ash of War’s description clearly notes this trait, stating that the skill "nullifies projectiles such as arrows while spinning."

A few other Elden Ring Ashes of War and spells can also nullify projectiles. E.g., the Zamor Ice Storm Sorcery does it, as does the eponymous weapon skill.

item.title: Infinity Nikki Reveals Multiplayer Co-op Details
item.description:
Summary

  • Infinity Nikki Version 1.5 is introducing multiplayer co-op in Miraland, emphasizing teamwork and exploration.
  • Players can share materials, rewards, and exploration progress together through co-op play in Infinity Nikki.
  • Co-op mode is set to launch on April 29, 2025.

Infinity Nikki is bringing multiplayer co-op to Miraland in Version 1.5, and Infold has revealed what players can expect from the feature going forward. When the developers originally announced that Infinity Nikki was getting multiplayer content in Version 1.5, fans had no idea what this really meant – while expectations weren't low, they were certainly measured. At a bare minimum, a new multiplayer zone was teased by Infinity Nikki , but Infold remained tight-lipped about everything else.

Following the recent developer livestream for Infinity Nikki , players have gained a lot more information on how multiplayer will work in Version 1.5. Players will be able to team up with other stylists anywhere in Miraland, but the Sea of Stars will specifically encourage co-op gameplay to solve its puzzles and explore its whimsical landscape. As a zone, it will allow fans to share their color schemes from the upcoming dye system, as well as enjoy the services of the Starlit Shop.

However, Infinity Nikki 's developer has further clarified how co-op multiplayer works. There are two ways to trigger the system: by sending an invitation via the Friend List or by interacting with a Starlit Projection in Miraland. What makes Infinity Nikki 's multiplayer mode stand out is that it allows players to share materials, rewards, and even exploration progress. For the latter, so long as players are holding hands, they can jointly collect Whimstars, Treasure Chests, and Dews of Inspiration in Infinity Nikki .

Infinity Nikki: What Players Can Do in Multiplayer Co-op

Holding hands will allow players to get the most out of the new Infinity Nikki outfits, as both Snowy Ballad and Crimson Feather have stronger exploration abilities in the co-op mode. For example, holding the hand of a fellow stylist will allow Nikki (and her friend) to float a longer distance when using the Crimson Feather set.

As for other features in co-op, players will be able to invite their guests for a group photo. Using this new feature, each Nikki will be able to pick her own pose in photo mode. Furthermore, players will also be able to chat in the open world, especially in areas such as Serenity Island or the Sea of Stars. While multiplayer is currently restricted to just two players, Infold is already supporting it with a plethora of items and gimmicks, such as a two-seat version of the Whim Pedals. Version 1.5 will launch on April 29, 2025, which will also coincide with Infinity Nikki 's release on Steam.

Infinity Nikki is the fifth installment in the beloved Nikki series developed by Infold Games. Utilizing the UE5 engine, this multi-platform game seamlessly blends the series' signature dress-up mechanics with open-world exploration elements. It also offers platforming, puzzle-solving, and many other gameplay elements to create a unique and rich experience.

In this game, Nikki and Momo embark on a new adventure, traveling across the fantastic nations of Miraland, each with its own unique culture and environment. Players will encounter many characters and whimsical creatures while collecting stunning outfits of various styles. Some of these outfits possess magical abilities essential for progressing through the story.

Bright and fantasy-filled open world
The world of Infinity Nikki offers a refreshing escape from traditional apocalyptic landscapes. It's bright, whimsical, and filled with magical creatures. Wander through this wonderful land and explore the beauty and charm around every corner.

Exceptional clothing design and dress-up experience
Express your style with an extensive collection of beautifully designed outfits, some of which even grant unique abilities. From floating and purifying to gliding and shrinking, these outfits unlock exciting new ways to explore the world and overcome challenges. Each outfit enriches your journey, letting you mix and match for the perfect look.

Platforming with endless fun
In this vast, fantastic world, master skills like floating, running, and plunging to freely explore the land and tackle intricately designed puzzles and challenges. The joy of 3D platforming is seamlessly integrated into the game's open-world exploration. Each scene is vibrant and charming—from soaring paper cranes, speeding wine cellar carts, mysterious ghost trains—so many hidden secrets await discovery!

Cozy sim activities and casual fun
Relax with activities like fishing, bug catching, or grooming animals. Everything Nikki collects on her journey helps craft new outfits. Whether you're in a meadow or by a river, there's a great chance that you'll encounter enchanting creatures that bring a sense of peace and immersion.

Diverse puzzles and mini-games
Infinity Nikki is filled with activities that challenge both wit and skill. Traverse scenic paths, enjoy a hot air balloon ride, complete platforming puzzles, or even play a hopscotch mini-game. These elements add variety and depth, ensuring every moment remains fresh and engaging.

item.title: Rumor: Honkai: Star Rail May Be Adding a New Type of Enemy
item.description:
Summary

  • Honkai: Star Rail may be planning to add a brand-new powerful type of enemy to the game in the near future.
  • Leaks have suggested that Honkai: Star Rail could be introducing its own "Local Legend" enemies as powerful overworld bosses.
  • Local Legends previously appeared as endgame overworld bosses found throughout Genshin Impact's Fontaine, Natlan, and Liyue regions.

A recent leak from Honkai: Star Rail could be dropping a major hint at a new type of enemy set to be added to the game in the future. The smash-hit sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse features a wide variety of ways for players to test their skills and team-building against some of the game's most powerful enemies. The game includes several different forms of endgame challenges, including Memory of Chaos as a gauntlet of powerful enemies and Pure Fiction focusing heavily around how fast players can clear waves of opponents. Now, a brand-new type of enemy may be coming soon.

While Honkai: Star Rail features several different forms of endgame content, the RPG's overworld has noticeably lacked powerful overworld enemies. Many of Star Rail 's strongest enemies are locked behind the various endgame modes, limited to the highest floors of each challenge. HoYoverse has introduced some powered-up enemies through the Apocalyptic Shadow game mode, though they are limited to the game's pre-existing Weekly Bosses. However, a new update may indicate some powerful overworld foes are on the way.

Honkai: Star Rail May Be Adding New Enemies

A recent leak shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Sakura Haven is potentially teasing a new enemy type coming to Honkai: Star Rail . According to the leak, the most recent update to the game's beta features some new data referencing "Local Legends" being added to the game. While the data did not specify what the Local Legends would be, the name suggests that Star Rail may be introducing a powerful new form of overworld enemy, similar to Genshin Impact 's Local Legend enemies. The update did not specify when the first Local Legends would be added to Honkai: Star Rail .

The introduction of Local Legends would see a popular endgame enemy subtype from the developer's previous game making the jump to Star Rail . First introduced in Genshin Impact 's Fontaine, Local Legends enemies have appeared throughout the game's past two regions, as well as a Local Legend retroactively added to the Liyue region. Local Legends serve as some of the toughest challenges in Genshin Impact 's overworld, both boasting staggering HP totals and dealing massive damage to unprepared players.

Honkai: Star Rail 's new Local Legends are just part of an exciting slate of content for the sci-fi RPG in the near future. Version 3.2 kicked off the game's anniversary celebrations with a plethora of rewards for players, as well as two new characters in Castorice and Anaxa. Rumors have also heavily suggested that Star Rail 's long-awaited crossover with Fate/Stay Night could be launching as soon as the Version 3.4 update. Between new characters and potential new enemies coming soon, Honkai: Star Rail has lots in store for the game's legions of fans.

item.title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 - How to Get & Use the Wooden Stick
item.description:
While exploring the continent in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , players will stumble upon plenty of mysteries, grand and small, and more often than not, the game won't handhold players to their solutions. While some hints are available to observant players, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is all about exploration, encouraging players to search every nook and cranny of each new area to uncover secrets, find powerful pictos, and solve side quests with unique rewards.

The small but rewarding quest involving the Wooden Stick is one such example. Players can encounter this quest in the Gestral Village, but it's easy to overlook exactly what this small quest item is for and how to use the Wooden Stick to earn a reward.

Where to Find the Wooden Stick in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

The Wooden Stick can be acquired in Gestral Village, which players reach naturally during the main story of Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 . The village itself is fairly large, so it will take some time to fully explore it and meet every funny Gestral who lives there. During exploration, players will find the Gestral Bazar, located to the left of the big Chief House in the center of the settlement.

While exploring the Bazar, players will meet one of the merchants — a Big Gestral with green hair. He'll offer to sell players a “legendary Excalibur weapon” for just 1,000 Chroma, but unlike other merchants, players won't be able to preview the weapon. Upon agreeing to the deal, players will receive the Wooden Stick quest item in their inventory, which cannot be equipped or used as a weapon. So, what is the real purpose of the Wooden Stick, and is it worth buying at all?

How to Use the Wooden Stick in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

The item's description already contains a small hint for players, stating that “Gestral kids are fond of good old wooden swords.” So now, all that's left is to find a kid who will like this sword. Luckily, players won't need to progress too far to use the Wooden Stick in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 , as the little Gestral we're looking for is located nearby, overseeing the Gestral Bazar from above.

The easiest way to find the Gestral kid is to return to the Chief House entrance and go left from there, hugging the wall to the right of the players. Upon reaching the first fork, players should go right, into the small back alley, where they will find a shining rope. Take the rope up, and keep following the only available path, which involves a bit of jumping and climbing, but don't worry — it's not difficult.

At the end of the pathway, players will find a Gestral kid sitting on a single high pillar. If players don't have the Wooden Stick in their inventory, talking to the kid will result in him refusing to come down. Luckily, players will have already bought the Wooden Stick from the merchant, so after a short dialogue, the kid is encouraged to get down.

The Wooden Stick Quest Rewards in Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

After that, all players need to do is return to the adult Gestral standing below (players can simply fall down from the pillar without retracing their steps) and talk to him. For their effort and hassle, the delighted creature rewards players with the unique cosmetic Sakapatate outfit for Lune, making the 1,000 Chrome spent on the wooden sword totally worth it after all.

item.title: Oblivion Remastered: All Rune Stones & Where to Find Them
item.description:
Oblivion Remastered gives the players all the freedom to explore its world, but it leaves out a lot of details regarding that world. There are many landmarks on the map that you can fast travel to. There are some minor landmarks that can give you great benefits, but aren’t visible on the map. Among these minor landmarks are rune stones, powerful stone formations covered in, well, runes, that give you certain boons when activated. There aren’t any requirements for activating a rune stone, but they can be difficult to find if you don’t know where to look.

What Are Rune Stones, And How Do They Work?

Rune stones are a minor landmark that players can find scattered around Cyrodiil. There are three types of rune stones: Hestra , Reman , and Sidri-Ashak . Each rune stone gives the player a different kind of bound weapon and armor.

Unfortunately, the summoned items only remain for a short amount of time, around 5 minutes of real-world time. However, these stones can be used multiple times a day. They cannot be unequipped until their duration runs out.

Each stone can only be activated once per day, though other stones of the same type can be activated.

Hestra Rune Stone Locations in Oblivion Remastered

Hestra Rune Stones give the player a Bound Dagger and Gauntlet. The gauntlets give you 3 armor , while the dagger gives you 5 damage . Hestra Rune stones glow a light green color and are found at ten locations within Cyrodiil.

It is easier to spot rune stones at night because of their characteristic glowing runes.

Closest City General Direction Closest Landmark Map Location
Imperial City Northwest Northeast of Fort Empire and southwest of Aleswell
Northeast At the south turn of the road going east from Roxy Inn
Northeast West of Sinkhole Cave, at the northeastern tip of the Imperial City island
Cheydinhal Northwest At the southern end of Lake Arrius
Northwest Northwest of Lake Arrius and Sedor
South South of Harlun’s Watch, in the “e” of Lake Poppod on the map
South West of Drakelow, across the river
Bruma East North of Namira’s Shrine, east of Wildeye Stables
Southeast South of Namira’s Shrine, east of the Silver Road
Northwest On the road leading away from Bruma North Gate

Reman Rune Stone Locations in Oblivion Remastered

The Reman Rune Stones grow a peculiar cyan color and arguably give the player the best armor and weapon combo. It grants you a two handed sword and a cuirass. The sword deals 10 damage while the cuirass has an armor rating of 6 . These stones are found in nine locations .

Two icons, one for the bound weapon and one for the bound armor, are located on the bottom left of the screen when a rune stone is activated. You can use these icons to tell how much time is left before your bound equipment disappears.

Closest City General Direction Closest Landmark Map Location
Imperial City West West of Fanacasecul
Skingrad North Jst south of Bleak Flats Cave, at the top the “k” of Skingrad on the map.
Kvatch East West of Fort Istirus
East North of Fort Istirus
Northeast Northwest of Talwinque
Northwest Just outside the northernmost part of Kvatch’s walls
Bravil Northeast Southwest of the Arrowshaft Cavern and east of Fort Entius on Silverfish River
Southeast South of Mount of the Panther
Leyawiin East On the road leading north from Leyawiin, just west of Veyond

Sidri-Ashak Rune Stone Locations in Oblivion Remastered

Sidri-Ashak Rune Stones have a bright green glow and are the best choice for long-range players, as they give you a bound bow and a bound helmet. The bow has a damage rating of 7 while the bound helmet has an armor rating of 3 . Combined, they make for a balanced build for an archer. These stones are only found at five locations in the game.

Closest City General Direction Closest Landmark Map Location
Imperial City South On the western tip of the island after the Old Bridge
Anvil Northwest West of Horse Whisperer Stables, within the “A” of Anvil on the map
Bruma Southwest Near the middle of the Orange Road
Cheydinhal North East of the Temple of the Ancestor Moths, north of Azura’s Shrine
Chorrol North North of Sancre Tor
